title: Configuration
content:
Links These are the links I used when creating this site. Below I’ve included what I did, hopefully without forgetting anything. Hugo documentation Hugo quick start guide Hugo Learn theme Learn documentation
Hugo init add theme theme setup color logo serve script for testing publish…
Setup I use two repos, one for the source for site generation, and one with the webpage. Source Webpage To set up a github webpage, follow this.
Create and clone both repos. Change directory to source repo directory. Initialize Hugo site using hugo new site --force Now add the Learn theme as a submodule using git submodule add https://pages.github.com/ themes/Learn.
And set theme = "Learn" or whatever whatever you checked the theme out as.
I use the following while developing the site hugo server -s ~/git/Site/ -d ~/git/clausholmgaard.github.io/ To start a local server and generate output in the webpage repo.
General Config Changing default colors Add the following to config.toml. [params] themeVariant = "blue"  Changing Logo Edit themes/Learn/layouts/partials/logo.html and place an html [img] reference.
<img src="/logo.png" height="100" width="200">  Adding new content Jupyter
